content: black cat basics cowl black cat basics patterns are designed for beginner knitters who want to make something they will actually want to wear the basics cowl is an excellent first knitting project as it s knit flat with no increasing or decreasing and only uses knit stitch the moebius construction makes this cowl something even experienced knitters will want to make and wear © alanna penk 2020 construction black cat basics cowl is knit flat sideways in garter stitch knit on both sides then twisted to create the moebius construction and sewn up at the side with a tapestry needle materials needed malabrigo rios yarn or similar worsted weight/10ply yarn to achieve gauge colour pictured cirrus grey you will need approx 174metres/190yards total 5mm/us size 8 straight or circular needle s cowl is worked flat tapestry needle for finishing gauge 9 stitches and 18 row= 5cm/2in in garter stitch abbreviations co= cast on k= knit sts= stitches finished measurements finished cowl measures approx 48cm/19in in circumference and 21 5cm/8 5in tall instructions using long-tail cast on co 40 sts row 1 k work row 1 a total of 170 times when counting row this will look like 85 bumps bind off all sts leaving a tail approx 3 times longer than the width of your knitting lay cowl flat and leaving the right side down lift the bottom left corner and fold it up to the top so that you have a half twist in the cowl otherwise called moebius using your tapestry needle and mattress stitch sew up the side seam of your cowl then weave in all ends to finish a helpful tutorial for the mattress stitch on garter fabric can be found here https //www youtube com/watch v=p5grhi-pgeg for pattern support contact alanna@blackcatknitco com www blackcatknittingcompany com ravelry blackcatknitco instagram blackcatknitco © alanna penk 2020
